trial_identification.studytitle: Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (rTMS) in the treatment of depression.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (rTMS) in the treatment of depression, assessed with HAMD-21 over a four week period.

interventions.interventions: Active control comparison of two different rTMS parameter sets, over the left dorsolateral prefrontal cortex. Additional to current medication. a) 10Hz frequency. 100% MT. b) Variable frequency dependent upon background activity. 100% MT.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Rating scales for depression for clinicians (Hamilton 21 point).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Before and after four weeks of treatment.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Rating scales for depression, self administered (Beck Depression Inventory).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Before and after four weeks of treatment.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: EEG recordings and a battery of cognition tests will also be administered.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Prior to treatment, after 4 weeks treatment, and 6 months post treatment.

trial_design.concealment: A random sequence was generated prior to recruitment, and used to allocate from a central station by phone. Staff involved in intervention or assessment have no access to the sequence.
trial_design.sequence: A computer package (SPSS for Windows11.5) randomly selected from 200 cases. Participants assigned in sequence of recruitment.

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Centre for Clinical Research in Neuropsychiatry

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study is designed to evaluate the therapeutic application of repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) as a potential treatment for depression.
